summary: The BMW M337 engine, produced from 1952 to 1958, is an evolution of its predecessor, the M78. It features a revised cylinder head, a new inlet manifold, and a reinforced crankshaft with larger bearings. Like the M78, the M337 has a cast iron engine block and cylinder head, and utilizes an overhead valve (OHV) design with two valves per cylinder. The engine has a displacement range of 2.0 to 2.1 liters and runs on petrol.
